title: Calories in Two Fried Eggs
meta_description: Learn calories in two fried eggs, plus detailed nutrition like protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), fried in 1 tsp oil total, no added salt or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, frying method, amount of added fat, and brand; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two large fried eggs offer ~180 kcal and ~13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in 1 tsp butter per egg
No added oil (pan-fried dry or poached)
Add 1 slice American cheese per egg

faqs.q: How many calories in one fried egg?
faqs.a: About 90 kcal for one large fried egg with minimal oil.

faqs.q: What's the protein in two fried eggs?
Do fried eggs have more calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added cooking fat; fried adds ~12-20 kcal per egg vs. boiled.

faqs.q: How much fat is in two fried eggs?
faqs.a: Around 14 g total fat, mostly from the yolk and frying oil.
Cholesterol (~185 mg per egg) comes from the yolk and isn't changed by frying.
